article.headline: Lamar 60, Sam Houston St. 57
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas -- Miles Anthony and Ashton Hall combined for 26 points, including three free throws in the final 11 seconds, to lead Lamar to a 60-57 victory over Sam Houston State on Wednesday night. Anthony made 1-of-2 free throws with 11 seconds remaining to give the Cardinals (13-11, 4-7 Southland) a 58-56 lead. That gave the Bearkats (14-10, 8-3) a chance to tie the game with four seconds left when Corey Allmond was fouled. He hit one of his two free throws to cut Lamar's lead to one. Hall then sank two free throws for the final margin. Anthony scored 15 points for the Cardinals and Hall had 11. Drae Murray led the Bearkats in scoring with 20 points off the bench while Barkley Falkner scored 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
